articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Russian Governor of Amur Region and His Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Russian Governor of Amur Region and His Party
						

					Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received Oleg Kozhemyako, governor of Amur Region of the Russian Federation, and his party on a visit to the DPRK on Thursday.
					
					 Present there were Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Ri Yong Chol, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK. 
					
					 Oleg Kozhemyako presented a gift to Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed thanks for this and warmly welcomed his visit to the DPRK and had a talk with him in a warm and friendly atmosphere. 
					
					 Oleg Kozhemyako expressed his sincerest thanks to Kim Jong Il for kindly inviting him, according him cordial hospitality and sparing his precious time to receive him, though he was very busy guiding the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					 He said it was great honor for the Amur Region that Kim Jong Il visited it during his Russia visit in August and it gave unforgettable impressions to the hearts of the people in the region. 
					
					 While visiting the DPRK, I could witness the fact that all the efforts being made in the DPRK under the guidance of the WPK led by Kim Jong Il are oriented to further improving the standard of the people's living, the governor said, adding that he was impressed to tour different parts of the DPRK including the construction site of the Huichon Power Station and the large-scale Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm. 
					
					 Noting it was of great significance that the top leaders of Russia and the DPRK promised each other to boost cooperation between the two countries and regions, he went on:
					
					 The Amur Region will take the lead in materializing the spirit of this agreement and prove itself to be an example in promoting the Russia-DPRK friendship and cooperation. 
					
					Kim Jong Il recollected his visit to the Bureya Power Station in the Amur Region with deep emotion and once again expressed thanks for the sincere and cordial hospitality accorded to him by officials and people of the region and asked the governor to convey his warm regards to the people of the Amur Region and all the people of Russia. 
					
					 After receiving the guests, Kim Jong Il hosted a dinner for them. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were the governor and his party and Valery Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK. 
					
					 Present there were Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Thae Jong Su and Ri Yong Chol. 
					
					 The dinner proceeded in a warm atmosphere overflowing with friendship.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets UN Official
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets UN Official 
						

					 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme Peoples' Assembly, Thursday had a talk with Valerie Amos, UN under secretary general for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief coordinator, and her party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.
					
					 Present there were Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of the DPRK Foreign Affairs, officials concerned and Jerome Sauvage, representative of the Office of U.N. Resident Coordinator and Resident Representative of the UNDP to the DPRK.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Feted
						

					 Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Thursday gave a reception in honor of the visiting delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel. 
					
					 Present there on invitation were the delegation of the Communist Party of Vietnam led by Hoang Binh Quan, chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Party Central Committee, Le Quang Ba, Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy here.
					
					 Secretary Kim Yong Il and officials of the Central Committee of the WPK were also present.
					
					 Kim Yong Il said the traditional bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation are growing stronger under the deep care of the top leaders of the two parties and the two countries.
					
					 The DPRK and Vietnam are closely linked in the road of common struggle for socialism against imperialism, he noted, adding that the DPRK would make efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the Communist Party of Vietnam in the future, too. 
					
					 Hoang Binh Quan said that the Vietnamese party, government and people always remember the support given by the party, government and people of the DPRK to the struggle for national liberation, realization of the reunification cause and socialist construction in Vietnam. 
					
					 The Vietnamese party, government and people will make every effort to further develop the friendly relations between the two countries, he added.
